Thanks for the A2A. Dear god, I seriously hope not. It’s amateurish, lazy, sloppy, they get in the reader’s way, they will annoy that reader, and I would never read a book that had emoticons in it. Never. If a writer cannot show their characters’ emotions without resorting to icons and smilies, then they shouldn’t be publishing anything at all, because they don’t know the first thing about writing. If I saw a book with emoticons in it, I’d trash it, look at the writer, and tell them to do some research on how to write a book. I don’t say that to be overly mean, even though it sounds like it, but that is how big of a mistake it would be to put emoticons in a book meant for publication. Just don’t do it.
